sentence.Network_en: Curia, whether the General Assembly, or upper house seats are not civilians.
sentence.Network_cn: 无论是库里亚大会, 还是元老院都没有平民的席位.

sentence.Network_en: Early Roman society and political organizations in the clan as a unit curia.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 元老院（curia）(Curia)，四层建筑物，是共和国时代政治的最高机关。农神神庙(TempiodiSaturno)，当时曾被人们视为重要的宫殿，在12月祭 …
罗马人的库里亚（curia）一词即希腊语中胞族一词的同义语。迪约奈修斯常常称库里亚为胞族。
外部人士可以对意大利人主导的教廷(Curia)进行改革，感召力强大的领袖则可以在世俗主义日益强大的情况下支撑教会。新闻报道称…
他建造了新的元老院会所(Curia)，建造了阿波罗神庙，建造了朱利乌斯神庙。他还在大角斗场（Circus Maximus）附近建神龛。

means.word_mean: 1. (Roman Catholic Church) the central administration governing the Roman Catholic Church

auth_sentence.content: Under current practices, Curia department heads meet only twice a year.
auth_sentence.res_content: Under current practices, Curia department heads meet only twice a year.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Under current practices, Curia department heads meet only twice a year.

auth_sentence.content: They have also pointed to a pressing need to reform the Vatican Curia, the central offices of the Church.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: They have also pointed to a pressing need to reform the Vatican Curia, the central offices of the Church.

auth_sentence.content: Gradually the devolving effect of those reforms has been eroded and the Curia has re-centralised power in the Church.
